column4: anyone know how to start the server install from the desktop install CD
you can't, I don't think.
mmm that strange considering it's is basicly the same with out any gui
you're talking about the liveCD installer, right?
yeah I think so, it's the dapper x86 install cd
the LiveCD one, right?
and it bootin into a live cd right now

right, I don't know if you can select a server install from that.  you definately can't choose the LAMP preinstall and stuff.  on the alternative (text-mode) installer, you can just type 'server' and install without ubuntu-desktop
I trying to install the server to an old PII 300 to make a  web caching server and porn filter so the live cd is going freakin slow
right, you probably should download the server iso.  you could use alternate installer, but server is 300mb smaller, and has optomized kernels
what is the LAMP preinstall
I C I guess I'm gonna have to down load that then
I have a limit to how much I can down load I downloaded the desktop version last night I was hopinh i could use it to do both
well, you can.
but, the liveCD might be too much for that computer.
since you can't install without going through the liveCD on that computer
O yeah I know it is! but I have a server set up on the same system fro someone else and it runs and does it's job exptreemly well
right, you can install via that, sure.  you'll just have to remove ubuntu-desktop after you install it.
yeah that's too bad
I'm just gonna have to bite the bullet and down load the server edition, guess I'm gonna have to limit my porn downloadin for this month LOL
thanks for the info
